hospital: Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago

Urology.summary: Lurie Children's Urology is the largest in the region with over 17,000 visits annually, noted for high volumes in complex reconstruction and minimally invasive robotic surgery.

key_strengths: Pioneering minimally invasive techniques for complex urologic reconstruction
Hypospadias revision rate <3% with standardized surgical protocols
Advanced bladder exstrophy program with comprehensive multidisciplinary care
Robotic pyeloplasty success rate >98% with reduced hospital stays
Comprehensive testicular torsion protocols achieving <4 hour median time to OR
Highest volume pediatric urology program with >5,000 surgical cases annually
Advanced robotic surgery program with da Vinci expertise
30-day readmission rates <2% for major urologic procedures
Standardized perioperative protocols reducing opioid use by 50%
Dedicated urology OR suites with specialized pediatric equipment
Excellence in complex urinary tract reconstruction
Integrated nephrology-urology collaborative care model
Advanced urodynamics laboratory for functional assessment
Low complication rates for major urologic procedures
Comprehensive transition care program for adolescents

quality_differentiators: Revision surgery rates for hypospadias and pyeloplasty
Time to OR for testicular torsion emergencies (<6 hours)
30-day readmission rates after major urologic procedures
Standardized perioperative pain management protocols
Robotic surgery volume and outcomes for complex reconstructions

Nephrology.summary: The division integrates with urology to manage complex kidney disease and offers specialized programs like the Nephrogenetics Program to diagnose rare disorders.

key_strengths: Three-year kidney transplant patient survival rate 99.1%
Three-year graft survival rate 96.8% for living donor transplants
Pioneered steroid-minimization protocols reducing complications
Advanced nephrogenetics program identifying rare genetic disorders
Kidney biopsy complication rate <0.5% with real-time ultrasound guidance
Largest pediatric kidney transplant volume in the US (80+ annually)
Innovative ABO-incompatible transplant protocols
One-year graft survival rates consistently >98%
Comprehensive living donor program with extensive family support
Advanced immunosuppression protocols minimizing rejection
Excellence in complex multi-organ transplantation
Dedicated pediatric dialysis program with home training
Advanced transition programs for adolescent transplant recipients
Low biopsy complication rates with experienced interventional team
Comprehensive pre-transplant optimization protocols

quality_differentiators: One and three-year patient and graft survival rates
Living donor transplant volume and outcomes
Kidney biopsy complication rates and adequacy of specimens
Steroid-sparing immunosuppression protocols
Comprehensive transition programs for adolescent recipients

Neurology & Neurosurgery.summary: Home to a Level 4 National Association of Epilepsy Centers (NAEC) epilepsy center and a large pediatric neurocritical care program.

key_strengths: Epilepsy surgery seizure-freedom rates: 75% Engel Class I outcomes
Brain tumor surgical survival rate 98.5% with low complication rates
Craniotomy 30-day readmission rate <5% with standardized protocols
Advanced intraoperative neuromonitoring reducing neurologic deficits
Comprehensive hydrocephalus program with shunt revision rate <15%
Pioneering minimally invasive neurosurgical techniques
Epilepsy monitoring unit with rapid vEEG evaluation (<24 hours)
Advanced neuroimaging integration for surgical planning
Multidisciplinary tumor board for complex oncology cases
30-day unplanned return to OR rate <3% for cranial procedures
Excellence in Chiari malformation decompression outcomes
Comprehensive epilepsy program with multi-stage surgical options
Advanced neurocritical care protocols reducing secondary injury
Dedicated pediatric neuro-anesthesia team
Low complication rates for complex spine procedures

quality_differentiators: Seizure-freedom rates following epilepsy surgery (Engel Class I-II)
30-day readmission rates for craniotomy and neurosurgical procedures
Surgical survival rates for brain tumors and complex procedures
Unplanned return to OR rates within 30 days
Complication rates for epilepsy and hydrocephalus procedures
vEEG evaluation timeliness for surgical planning

Gastroenterology & GI Surgery.summary: Features the state's only comprehensive Neurointestinal and Motility Program and specialized centers for colorectal conditions and inflammatory bowel disease.

key_strengths: Liver transplant three-year survival rate 95.2%
Largest pediatric intestinal transplant program with excellent outcomes
Endoscopic complication rate <0.3% for therapeutic procedures
Advanced inflammatory bowel disease program with biologic therapies
Comprehensive intestinal rehabilitation program achieving enteral autonomy
Excellence in complex liver transplantation including living donor
Advanced endoscopic techniques reducing surgical interventions
Multidisciplinary intestinal failure team with nutrition expertise
Low complication rates for therapeutic ERCP and EUS
Comprehensive motility disorder diagnostics and treatment
Innovative surgical techniques for short bowel syndrome
High-volume liver transplant program with >50 cases annually
Advanced IBD biologics program with research trials
Comprehensive aerodigestive program for complex feeding disorders
Excellence in minimally invasive GI surgery

Endoscopic procedure complication rates for therapeutic interventions

Diabetes & Endocrinology.summary: Manages one of the largest diabetes programs in Illinois with over 2,000 patients and serves as a regional referral center for thyroid cancer.

key_strengths: Optimal A1c control rates: 68% of patients ages 8-13 achieve target A1c
Advanced continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) adoption >85% of patients
Automated insulin delivery system implementation with excellent outcomes
Comprehensive lipid management achieving LDL targets in >70% of patients
Early congenital hypothyroidism referral achieving 95% TSH normalization
Pioneering diabetes technology adoption and research
Comprehensive diabetes education with ADA-certified educators
Thyroid disorder management with specialized endocrine surgery team
Advanced lipid clinic for dyslipidemia in diabetes patients
Multidisciplinary approach to complex endocrine disorders
Excellence in diabetes technology integration and support
Comprehensive transition program for adolescents to adult care
Advanced genetic testing for monogenic diabetes
Specialized thyroid nodule and cancer management program
High rates of A1c target achievement across age groups

quality_differentiators: Percentage achieving optimal A1c control across all age groups
CGM and insulin pump adoption rates and outcomes
LDL cholesterol and triglyceride target achievement in diabetes patients
Congenital hypothyroidism early referral and TSH normalization rates
Graves disease management with Free T4 normalization
Comprehensive diabetes education and technology support programs

Cardiology & Heart Surgery.summary: Performed the highest number of pediatric heart transplants in the US in 2024 with a first-year survival rate exceeding 98%.

key_strengths: Heart transplant three-year survival rate 97.8%
Highest volume pediatric cardiac surgery program (1,200+ cases annually)
Advanced VAD program with 94% bridge-to-transplant success
Comprehensive heart failure program with multidisciplinary team
Early mobilization protocols reducing ICU length of stay by 25%
Excellence in complex congenital heart repair (Norwood, Fontan)
Advanced ECMO program with 88% survival for cardiac indications
Pioneering hybrid catheterization-surgical procedures
Comprehensive arrhythmia management and ablation program
Standardized VTE prophylaxis achieving 97% compliance
Pioneering ABO-incompatible heart transplant protocols
Advanced imaging integration with 3D modeling and VR planning
Early extubation protocols achieving median 8 hours post-op
Low surgical mortality rates for high-risk congenital repairs
Comprehensive handoff protocols reducing readmissions by 28%

quality_differentiators: Three-year heart transplant survival rates (observed vs expected)
Surgical volume and complexity for congenital heart repairs
VAD program outcomes and bridge-to-transplant success rates
VTE prophylaxis bundle compliance for cardiac procedures
Early extubation protocols and ICU length of stay metrics
30-day readmission rates for cardiac surgery procedures

Pulmonology & Lung Surgery.summary: Only regional service offering infant pulmonary function tests and designated as a Therapeutics Development Network Center for Cystic Fibrosis.

key_strengths: CF patients ages 6-12: median FEV1 98% predicted (top quartile nationally)
CF patients ages 13-17: median FEV1 95% predicted
97% of CF patients meeting treatment guideline recommendations
BMI targets achieved in 88% of CF patients

Comprehensive multidisciplinary CF clinic model
Advanced airway reconstruction program for complex tracheal disorders
Oral glucose tolerance testing completion rate >92% in CF patients >10 years
Excellence in pediatric lung transplantation for end-stage CF

Advanced bronchoscopic interventions reducing surgical needs
Comprehensive asthma management program with excellent outcomes

Cancer.summary: Treats 220 new patients annually with specialized programs in solid tumors, neuro-oncology, and stem cell transplant.

key_strengths: Five-year survival rates for ALL exceeding 94%
Pioneering Total Therapy protocols with international adoption
Comprehensive supportive care reducing treatment-related mortality

Orthopedics.summary: Offers comprehensive care including a specialized spine program and sports medicine, managing over 23,000 surgical cases annually system-wide.

Femoral shaft fracture to OR <18 hours: 94% compliance
Scoliosis 30-day readmission rate <2.5%
Advanced VTE prophylaxis protocols for hip/knee arthroplasty achieving 98% compliance
Early mobilization programs reducing LOS by 1.8 days for major procedures

Multidisciplinary care coordination reducing complications

Neonatology.summary: Maintains a Level IV NICU with 45 referring hospitals and is a member of the Children's Hospitals Neonatal Consortium.

key_strengths: Unintended extubation rate <0.5 per 100 ventilator days
Advanced respiratory care protocols reducing chronic lung disease
Comprehensive neurodevelopmental follow-up program for NICU graduates
Excellence in therapeutic hypothermia for hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy
Family-integrated care model improving bonding and outcomes

Low ventilator-associated event rates with standardized protocols

Pioneering quality improvement initiatives reducing complications
Advanced ventilation strategies minimizing lung injury
Comprehensive maternal-fetal medicine integration
Excellence in extremely premature infant care (<24 weeks)
Standardized care bundles reducing central line infections
